content: Did you notice when Bush was in office that he talked to all news reporters big and small? But why doesn't Obama, Pelosi, Reid, and others? Now I expect the peanut gallery to explode but one thing I have noticed about Fox news which I really like is they basically ask yes or no questions and never get a yes or no answer from politicians. Another thing I have noticed is that Fox news investigates wrong doing more than other news stations. Oh sure I watch 20/20 and dateline but mostly they are entertainment stories or crime scenarios. Just for a week try watching the Glenn Beck news show and listen to what he has to say. I know he likes to kid around most of the time but notice what he says is never rebuked by the democrats. I wonder why? Another example of Fox news being a thorn in the side of the democratic party is when they kept showing the fly over by Air Force One. The man responsible resigned over it. It was stupid but NBC, ABC, and CBS covered it and let it go. Not Fox. They keep at it until someone is held accountable. That I like and that is why they are the best news team out their IMO.

I don't think Meet the Press is as tough as it once was with Tim Russert but for me Glen Beck is absolutely the one news show I do watch regularly. He has the best people on and will ask tough questions and great followup. I know that he goofs around and gets emotional but for me it is worth it to see him grill people. His segment last week with a SPOKESMAN for ACORN was brilliant followed by a interview 2-3 nights later with 2 ladies on the board of ACORN airing their real problems with the national office and the direction ACORN is heading.

Now I expect the peanut gallery to explode but one thing I have noticed about Fox news which I really like is they basically ask yes or no questions and never get a yes or no answer from politicians. Another thing I have noticed is that Fox news investigates wrong doing more than other news stations. Oh sure I watch 20/20 and dateline but mostly they are entertainment stories or crime scenarios. Just for a week try watching the Glenn Beck news show and listen to what he has to say. I know he likes to kid around most of the time but notice what he says is never rebuked by the democrats. I wonder why? Another example of Fox news being a thorn in the side of the democratic party is when they kept showing the fly over by Air Force One. The man responsible resigned over it.
